title: MOTDx is a fresh and welcome look at football beyond action on the pitch
text:
This week, we turn our attention to BBC Two’s Thursday evening show, MOTDx. First contact with the title of this youth-oriented football magazine programme in the TV listings raised the possibility that the little “x” at the end might be either a typographical mistake or a text-message style kiss, but it is in fact … well, it’s not really clear what it is, but it denotes some sort of spin-off, or yoof, or otherwise non-mainstream bit of football telly, anyhow.

The “MOTD” is, of course, “Match Of The Day” and this offshoot programme then could be either Match Of The Day Smooch, or perhaps “x” as in multiplied, or something to do with chromosomes. We may never know. What we do know, however, is...
description: This week, we turn our attention to BBC Two’s Thursday evening show, MOTDx.
